intro: Grindelia inuloides, commonly known as the desert gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and silvery-gray foliage, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Grindelia inuloides has a taproot system that allows it to access deep groundwater, making it well adapted to drought conditions. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
